description: Learn Genghis Khan's Rise in one minute.

hook.text: A kidnapped, starving outcast on the Mongolian steppe became the most successful conqueror in history.

twist.text: He promoted soldiers by merit, not birth. A shepherd's son could outrank a noble. Loyalty mattered most.

climax.text: By his death in 1227, he'd conquered more land than the Romans acquired in 400 years.

punchline.text: History's greatest conqueror started with nothing.

quiz.question: How did Genghis Khan choose military commanders?
options: By noble birth and royal bloodline
By merit and loyalty, regardless of birth
By choosing the oldest warriors available
